body: Your Code style violates with the Style Rules... thats why Travis fails... :)

Hi @DSUK, and welcome!

This looks like a good start, but will need some more refinements before we can consider merging this:
- Like @Mailaender mentioned, the changes that don't directly relate to this feature will need to be reverted, and the installer will need to detect and install from both the original disks and TFD.
- The code style inside `InstallShieldCABExtractor` fails our [coding standard](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Coding-Standard) verification, and will need to be reformatted.  You can look at the output of the travis builds or run `make check` locally to see the list of violations.
- The `InstallShieldCABExtractor` code looks to be translated from another language / project.  What license was this originally released under?  It must be GPLv3 compatible for us to be able to include it.

Please let us know if you have any questions about how to work through these points.

@pchote the code was translated from libunshield, which is MIT so that's not a problem.

do the dependencies have to be GPL Compatible?  If so I might have to find an alternative to DotNetZip.
We already use SharpZipLib, so I really hope that you can make use of that instead of requiring two different zip libraries.
To avoid these merge commits try https://help.github.com/articles/about-git-rebase/ instead.
Removed the dependency, it seems to install TD okay.

Here are a few more style-related comments ;)
I haven't looked at the code much yet, but the fact that you are not using our `IFolder` concerns me a little. Please look at how `BigFile`, `Folder`, `MixFile` and `ZipFile` are done, and consider creating a similar `CabFile`. I think that would be most useful with our FileSystem architecture.
You will also need to squash the commit at some point, but that can wait.
If you have questions you can find us on IRC.

You will need to add `OpenRA.Game/FileSystem/InstallShieldCABExtractor.cs` and `OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Installation/InstallFromTTFDLogic.cs` to the respective `.csproj` files. Otherwise our Windows build will be incomplete. It is also suggested to use an IDE such as @MonoDevelop.
I'd like to point out that The First Decade is commonly abbreviated as TFD, not TTFD. I have no idea what the second T means.
terrific ...

Hey guys, thanks for the feedback :). As an update i am working on getting the CAB extractor to implement IFolder.
I would like to ask how are the classic hashes used? and would a hash collision be a issue if one was to  occur?

and @GraionDilach I have no idea where the second T has come from. I will amend accordingly :)

The two hash methods are there as kludges to support the westwood mix formats, which don't include any filename metadata but only the classic hashes (TD/RA) or CRCs (TS/RA2).

As a general note: the filesystem code is full of technical debt and has fundamental limitations because of the constraints of the mix format.  There have been discussions and long-term plans about having the installer repackage the mixes into a more sensible format so that we can then replace the filesystem layer with something more sensible.  With this and #8119 that idea is again topical.

Repackaging is a good idea, as I've said, and I do want to see it done one day (or even do it myself), but let's not confuse @DSUK here.
This PR should have two major parts:
1. Implement a nice CAB extractor (add support for our FileSystem to open CAB files)
2. Add TD installation from TFD CD.

P.S.: Glad to hear you're working on this @DSUK  :)
Looks like this is progressing, but not yet done. Leave a comment if you want someone to take another look at the code (or when you're ready), or come see us on IRC for easier communication. :)
Made a couple of amendments, I can't quite understand why the appveyor is failing though

OK, this is looking good style-wise.
A few more minor style nits:
- Add new lines before constructors (some of them are crammed into the class/struct fields).
- There are a couple of properties (like `public int Priority` that can be done in a single line).
- This may be a bit controversial, but I'd like a region around those structs.

Looks like this was silently updated.
I haven't tested, and haven't read the code in detail yet, but architecturally it looks good now. Also code style looks OK. I'd say this is ready for a proper review now.
to make this compatible with @penev92's cab extractor, this is going to expect a .hdr file rather than a .cab ( ISCFs compose of multiple foo#.cab and possibly multiple foo#.hdr files )
I don't have any TFD disk, so I can't test this. My only comment towards this PR is that I'd re-arrange the download buttons like this: `[Cancel]_______[Download] [ Use CD ] [ First Decade ]`
`First Decade` is also a CD so `Use CD` is a bit confusing.
@Phrohdoh  I can't think of a clearer terminology, but I don't personally find it confusing,  "CnC CD" better?
Wasn't it `CnC Gold` or something similar?
Could we have a single button that tries the CnC Gold disks, and then TFD if that isn't found?
TD was originally sold as just a DOS Game, Gold is the version with win95 installation with SVGA graphics etc. Not all TD Disks are gold :)
Might be a little extra work but i could try Inherit from InstallFromCDLogic and make it work for either disk. so we'd only need 2 buttons for download and CD?
No need to subclass it - this is needed for RA and TS too.
This seems to play nice with non TFD games, Installs C&C and fewer buttons.

Two things I noticed:
- The installation hijacks the UI thread, so the game is effectively frozen for the duration of the file extraction (usually there's supposed to be a nice dialog with a progress bar).
- The extracted files total up to 50.0 MB. The files I get from the Download button total a 97.5 MB. That is a bit odd.

@penev92  strange, I got about 12MB for Download and ~50MB for CD
du -m \*  in both cases produces for me

TFD:
2   conquer.mix
1   desert.mix
3   general.mix
38  scores.mix
2   sounds.mix
1   speech.mix
1   temperat.mix
1   tempicnh.mix
4   transit.mix
1   winter.mix

Download:
1   cclocal.mix
2   conquer.mix
1   desert.mix
3   general.mix
1   mirrors.txt
2   sounds.mix
1   speech.mix
1   temperat.mix
1   tempicnh.mix
2   transit.mix
1   updatec.mix
1   winter.mix

(I think i have a few indexes mixed up, will patch that)
but that Download section doesn't add up to 97MB

I will work on the UI for the next push, especially since it takes quite a bit of time to install RA2 and a thus lacking a progress bar is more noticeable.
I have added a progress bar to the UI :)
